resources.string: Discover your risk of death due COVID-19 infection.
Which race/ethnicity group you most closely associate with?
Please specify your sex assigned at birth.
What is your height in feet/inches?
What is your weight in pounds(lbs)?
Have you ever been diagnosed with any of the following conditions?
Is your diabetes controlled or Uncontrolled?
Please select the type of Cancer you been diagnosed with?
How long have you been diagnosed with hematological cancer?
How long have you been diagnosed with non-hematological cancer?
Controlled (HbA1c more than or equal to 7.5%)
Chronic respiratory disease (other than asthma) including COPD, fibrosing lung disease, bronchiectasis, or cystic fibrosis
Chronic heart disease including chronic heart failure, ischaemic heart disease, and severe valve congenital heart disease
Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA), Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) or Psoriasis
Close to or lower than average

Based on the information you have provided, the tool estimates that you have %1$s (95%% CI: %2$s - %3$s) times the risk of dying from COVID-19 compared to the average risk for the US population. Based on the estimated risk, you are categorized to be at %4$s risk based on the following chart:

Further, based on the information available from pandemic projections in your state of residence, the tool estimates an absolute rate of mortality of %1$s (95%% CI: %2$s - %3$s) per %4$s individuals in subgroups of the population with a similar risk profile to yours during the period of %5$s

This an Android application is for visualizing current COVID-19 data and asserting individuals\' death risk when infected with COVID-19 using various APIs and a systematic risk calculator developed by Johns Hopkins University
COVID19API, a free API for data on the Coronavirus sourced from Johns Hopkins CSSE.
The New York Times COVID-19 Data, a collection of COVID-19 Data gathered by The New York Times.
Data.CDC.gov, a collection of COVID-19 Vaccinations numbers for Pfizer, Moderna, and Janssen vaccinations.

The current risk-score calculation was developed using information on the risk for COVID-19 mortality associated with age, gender, race, social deprivation and 12 different health conditions published in a recent large UK study. The risk score was adopted to US setting by information on mortality rate by age and various race/ethnicity groups published by the Center for Disease Control. Further relative risks for individuals are provided by standardization with respect to average risk for the US population, calculated using available information on prevalence and co-occurrence of various risk-factors available form national databases.
This feature will be implemented later
